column4: Is there a way to make a back up of my dvds onto a single sided dvd-r?
apt-cache search dvdshrink
there are many many more ways
do you prefer that over k9copy and kc3
i prefer doing it myself manually.. i just know some names
it's just I am trying to figure out how to get a program to compress it ennough to fit on a dvd
try the ?dvdshrink stuff , all i know...
sometimes, or used to be, a symlink was not created in /dev linking a dvd to the block device...  do written dvd's work? a blank cd/dvd won't show much... cat the block device
yeah I just created and iso from a written dvd
define 'nothing happens'  what do you expect to happen when you put in a blank
I see that there is a disk on the desktop that is blank
ok that's gnome... but does your burning app see it
no
not sure.
does cat /dev/dvd (or whatever the dvd is) return anything?
nope it says there is no medium in there
i take it you tried >1 blank ... do written dvd's function as expected?
yeah blank cds work for burning and written dvds/cds work and I tried more than one blank dvd
ssh retour ?
what is ssh retour?
you might mention that it used to see the blank dvd's
it did used to show you the blank dvd's when you put them in, correct? or am i hallucinating?
nah only blank cds
